artist: Hugo Blomberg Ralph Lysell GÃ¶sta Thames Telefonaktiebolaget LM Ericsson, Stockholm, Sweden
creditline: Gift of Richard and Diana Rose
description: telephone with ivory colored plastic case; vertical design; rests on large bottom section with dial on bottom; large red button at center of black dial
text: Designed in the 1940s but produced in the late 1950s and 1960s by the L.M. Ericsson Company, the <I>Ericofon<I> represents the incorporation of new materials into Scandinavian design of the post-war period.  Designers Blomberg, Lysell, and Thames used lightweight plastic to create a practical, one-piece phone with the dial on the bottom, retaining the functionalism of previous decades while experimenting with a sculptural, curved form often described as a cobra.
title: "Ericofon" rotary-dial telephones
